text:
I want to declare my love for the Julia REPL. Looking at my old Python code, I was horrified to find that used Jupyter Notebooks to program, and then copy-pasted the content into `.py` files. I did that because I like interactive workflows, and Python's REPL is abysmal.

Having a good REPL is one of those quality of life-things that *could* have been swept under the rug as "not important". In contrast, Julia has implemented *so many* small things that make the REPL an absolute joy. All of you who contributed to that are much appreciated.

text: Do you use <@U67D54KS8>’s OhMyREPL? If not, you should try that out!

elements.text: Do you use
’s OhMyREPL? If not, you should try that out!

text: I do have that loaded on startup, and it's glorious. Appreciation to him, too!

elements.text: I do have that loaded on startup, and it's glorious. Appreciation to him, too!

text: Hey <@U7HAYKY9X> - agree with you about the Python REPL! I still use Python for other projects and if you want a nice alternative, I really enjoy `bpython`REPL - adds a fair bit more interactivity and has a history like the Julia REPL. Though I agree - Julia's offering is much nicer.

elements.text: Hey
- agree with you about the Python REPL! I still use Python for other projects and if you want a nice alternative, I really enjoy
bpython
REPL - adds a fair bit more interactivity and has a history like the Julia REPL. Though I agree - Julia's offering is much nicer.

text: I'll have a look. IPython is also nicer than the default, but not near the level of Julia

elements.text: I'll have a look. IPython is also nicer than the default, but not near the level of Julia

text: Definitely. Julia is the first language where I have used the REPL to the point where I now miss it in other languages. OhMyREPL is also great. Anyone have other recommendations for quality of life REPL packages?

elements.text: Definitely. Julia is the first language where I have used the REPL to the point where I now miss it in other languages. OhMyREPL is also great. Anyone have other recommendations for quality of life REPL packages?
Revise?

text: Also, have Debugger ready to go!

elements.text: Also, have Debugger ready to go!

text: <@U011V2YN59N> TheFix.jl by Michel Slevisnky is amazing.

elements.text: TheFix.jl by Michel Slevisnky is amazing.

text: Self - plug: soon, DoctorDocstrings.jl for setting up your REPL docstrings in your packages.

elements.text: Self - plug: soon, DoctorDocstrings.jl for setting up your REPL docstrings in your packages.

text: TerminalMenus.jl in Base now is pretty cool interface as well. UnicodePlots.jl is a classic.

elements.text: TerminalMenus.jl in Base now is pretty cool interface as well. UnicodePlots.jl is a classic.
